instanceMethods.name: pasteAndMatchStyle
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `pasteAndMatchStyle` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: delete
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `delete` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: selectAll
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `selectAll` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: unselect
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `unselect` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: replace
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `replace` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: replaceMisspelling
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command `replaceMisspelling` in web page.

instanceMethods.name: insertText
instanceMethods.description: Inserts `text` to the focused element.

instanceMethods.name: findInPage
instanceMethods.description:
The request id used for the request.

Starts a request to find all matches for the `text` in the web page. The result of the request can be obtained by subscribing to `found-in-page` event.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Content to be searched, must not be empty.

properties.name: forward
properties.description: Whether to search forward or backward, defaults to `true`.

properties.name: findNext
properties.description: Whether the operation is first request or a follow up, defaults to `false`.

properties.name: matchCase
properties.description: Whether search should be case-sensitive, defaults to `false`.

properties.name: wordStart
properties.description: Whether to look only at the start of words. defaults to `false`.

properties.name: medialCapitalAsWordStart
properties.description: When combined with `wordStart`, accepts a match in the middle of a word if the match begins with an uppercase letter followed by a lowercase or non-letter. Accepts several other intra-word matches, defaults to `false`.

instanceMethods.name: stopFindInPage
instanceMethods.description: Stops any `findInPage` request for the `webContents` with the provided `action`.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Specifies the action to take place when ending [`webContents.findInPage`] request.

possibleValues.description: Clear the selection.
Translate the selection into a normal selection.
Focus and click the selection node.

instanceMethods.name: capturePage
instanceMethods.description:
Resolves with a NativeImage

Captures a snapshot of the page within `rect`. Omitting `rect` will capture the whole visible page.

parameters.name: rect
parameters.description: The area of the page to be captured.

instanceMethods.name: isBeingCaptured
instanceMethods.description: Whether this page is being captured. It returns true when the capturer count is large then 0.

instanceMethods.name: incrementCapturerCount
instanceMethods.description:
Increase the capturer count by one. The page is considered visible when its browser window is hidden and the capturer count is non-zero. If you would like the page to stay hidden, you should ensure that `stayHidden` is set to true.

This also affects the Page Visibility API.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The perferred size for the capturer.

parameters.name: stayHidden
parameters.description: Keep the page hidden instead of visible.

instanceMethods.name: decrementCapturerCount
instanceMethods.description: Decrease the capturer count by one. The page will be set to hidden or occluded state when its browser window is hidden or occluded and the capturer count reaches zero. If you want to decrease the hidden capturer count instead you should set `stayHidden` to true.

parameters.name: stayHidden
parameters.description: Keep the page in hidden state instead of visible.

instanceMethods.name: getPrinters
instanceMethods.description: Get the system printer list.

instanceMethods.name: print
instanceMethods.description:
Prints window's web page. When `silent` is set to `true`, Electron will pick the system's default printer if `deviceName` is empty and the default settings for printing.

Use `page-break-before: always;` CSS style to force to print to a new page.

Example usage:

properties.name: silent
properties.description: Don't ask user for print settings. Default is `false`.

properties.name: printBackground
properties.description: Prints the background color and image of the web page. Default is `false`.

properties.name: deviceName
properties.description: Set the printer device name to use. Must be the system-defined name and not the 'friendly' name, e.g 'Brother_QL_820NWB' and not 'Brother QL-820NWB'.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Set whether the printed web page will be in color or grayscale. Default is `true`.

properties.name: marginType
properties.description: Can be `default`, `none`, `printableArea`, or `custom`. If `custom` is chosen, you will also need to specify `top`, `bottom`, `left`, and `right`.

properties.name: top
properties.description: The top margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: The bottom margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: left
properties.description: The left margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: right
properties.description: The right margin of the printed web page, in pixels.

properties.name: landscape
properties.description: Whether the web page should be printed in landscape mode. Default is `false`.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: The scale factor of the web page.

properties.name: pagesPerSheet
properties.description: The number of pages to print per page sheet.

properties.name: collate
properties.description: Whether the web page should be collated.

properties.name: copies
properties.description: The number of copies of the web page to print.

properties.name: pageRanges
properties.description: The page range to print. Should have two keys: `from` and `to`.

properties.name: duplexMode
properties.description: Set the duplex mode of the printed web page. Can be `simplex`, `shortEdge`, or `longEdge`.

properties.name: horizontal
properties.description: The horizontal dpi.

properties.name: vertical
properties.description: The vertical dpi.

properties.name: header
properties.description: String to be printed as page header.

properties.name: footer
properties.description: String to be printed as page footer.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: Indicates success of the print call.

parameters.name: failureReason
parameters.description: Error description called back if the print fails.

instanceMethods.name: printToPDF
instanceMethods.description:
Resolves with the generated PDF data.

Prints window's web page as PDF with Chromium's preview printing custom settings.

The `landscape` will be ignored if `@page` CSS at-rule is used in the web page.

By default, an empty `options` will be regarded as:

Use `page-break-before: always;` CSS style to force to print to a new page.

An example of `webContents.printToPDF`:

properties.name: marginsType
properties.description: Specifies the type of margins to use. Uses 0 for default margin, 1 for no margin, and 2 for minimum margin.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: Specify page size of the generated PDF. Can be `A3`, `A4`, `A5`, `Legal`, `Letter`, `Tabloid` or an Object containing `height` and `width` in microns.

properties.name: printBackground
properties.description: Whether to print CSS backgrounds.

properties.name: printSelectionOnly
properties.description: Whether to print selection only.

properties.name: landscape
properties.description: `true` for landscape, `false` for portrait.

instanceMethods.name: addWorkSpace
instanceMethods.description: Adds the specified path to DevTools workspace. Must be used after DevTools creation:

instanceMethods.name: removeWorkSpace
instanceMethods.description: Removes the specified path from DevTools workspace.

instanceMethods.name: setDevToolsWebContents
instanceMethods.description:
Uses the `devToolsWebContents` as the target `WebContents` to show devtools.

The `devToolsWebContents` must not have done any navigation, and it should not be used for other purposes after the call.

By default Electron manages the devtools by creating an internal `WebContents` with native view, which developers have very limited control of. With the `setDevToolsWebContents` method, developers can use any `WebContents` to show the devtools in it, including `BrowserWindow`, `BrowserView` and `<webview>` tag.

Note that closing the devtools does not destroy the `devToolsWebContents`, it is caller's responsibility to destroy `devToolsWebContents`.

An example of showing devtools in a `<webview>` tag:

An example of showing devtools in a `BrowserWindow`:

instanceMethods.name: openDevTools
instanceMethods.description:
Opens the devtools.

When `contents` is a `<webview>` tag, the `mode` would be `detach` by default, explicitly passing an empty `mode` can force using last used dock state.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: Opens the devtools with specified dock state, can be `right`, `bottom`, `undocked`, `detach`. Defaults to last used dock state. In `undocked` mode it's possible to dock back. In `detach` mode it's not.

properties.name: activate
properties.description: Whether to bring the opened devtools window to the foreground. The default is `true`.

instanceMethods.name: closeDevTools
instanceMethods.description: Closes the devtools.

instanceMethods.name: isDevToolsOpened
instanceMethods.description: Whether the devtools is opened.

instanceMethods.name: isDevToolsFocused
instanceMethods.description: Whether the devtools view is focused .

instanceMethods.name: toggleDevTools
instanceMethods.description: Toggles the developer tools.

instanceMethods.name: inspectElement
instanceMethods.description: Starts inspecting element at position (`x`, `y`).

instanceMethods.name: inspectSharedWorker
instanceMethods.description: Opens the developer tools for the shared worker context.

instanceMethods.name: inspectSharedWorkerById
instanceMethods.description: Inspects the shared worker based on its ID.

instanceMethods.name: getAllSharedWorkers
instanceMethods.description: Information about all Shared Workers.

instanceMethods.name: inspectServiceWorker
instanceMethods.description: Opens the developer tools for the service worker context.

instanceMethods.name: send
instanceMethods.description:
Send an asynchronous message to the renderer process via `channel`, along with arguments. Arguments will be serialized with the Structured Clone Algorithm, just like `postMessage`, so prototype chains will not be included. Sending Functions, Promises, Symbols, WeakMaps, or WeakSets will throw an exception.

> **NOTE**: Sending non-standard JavaScript types such as DOM objects or special Electron objects is deprecated, and will begin throwing an exception starting with Electron 9.

The renderer process can handle the message by listening to `channel` with the `ipcRenderer` module.

An example of sending messages from the main process to the renderer process:

instanceMethods.name: sendToFrame
instanceMethods.description:
Send an asynchronous message to a specific frame in a renderer process via `channel`, along with arguments. Arguments will be serialized with the Structured Clone Algorithm, just like `postMessage`, so prototype chains will not be included. Sending Functions, Promises, Symbols, WeakMaps, or WeakSets will throw an exception.

> **NOTE**: Sending non-standard JavaScript types such as DOM objects or special Electron objects is deprecated, and will begin throwing an exception starting with Electron 9.

The renderer process can handle the message by listening to `channel` with the `ipcRenderer` module.

If you want to get the `frameId` of a given renderer context you should use the `webFrame.routingId` value.  E.g.

You can also read `frameId` from all incoming IPC messages in the main process.

instanceMethods.name: enableDeviceEmulation
instanceMethods.description: Enable device emulation with the given parameters.

properties.name: screenPosition
properties.description: Specify the screen type to emulate (default: `desktop`):

possibleValues.description: Desktop screen type.
Mobile screen type.

properties.name: screenSize
properties.description: Set the emulated screen size (screenPosition == mobile).

properties.name: viewPosition
properties.description: Position the view on the screen (screenPosition == mobile) (default: `{ x: 0, y: 0 }`).

properties.name: deviceScaleFactor
properties.description: Set the device scale factor (if zero defaults to original device scale factor) (default: `0`).

properties.name: viewSize
properties.description: Set the emulated view size (empty means no override)

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Scale of emulated view inside available space (not in fit to view mode) (default: `1`).

instanceMethods.name: disableDeviceEmulation
instanceMethods.description: Disable device emulation enabled by `webContents.enableDeviceEmulation`.

instanceMethods.name: sendInputEvent
instanceMethods.description: Sends an input `event` to the page. **Note:** The `BrowserWindow` containing the contents needs to be focused for `sendInputEvent()` to work.

instanceMethods.name: beginFrameSubscription
instanceMethods.description:
Begin subscribing for presentation events and captured frames, the `callback` will be called with `callback(image, dirtyRect)` when there is a presentation event.

The `image` is an instance of NativeImage that stores the captured frame.

The `dirtyRect` is an object with `x, y, width, height` properties that describes which part of the page was repainted. If `onlyDirty` is set to `true`, `image` will only contain the repainted area. `onlyDirty` defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: onlyDirty
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`.

instanceMethods.name: endFrameSubscription
instanceMethods.description: End subscribing for frame presentation events.

instanceMethods.name: startDrag
instanceMethods.description: Sets the `item` as dragging item for current drag-drop operation, `file` is the absolute path of the file to be dragged, and `icon` is the image showing under the cursor when dragging.

properties.name: file
properties.description: The path(s) to the file(s) being dragged.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The image must be non-empty on macOS.

instanceMethods.name: savePage
instanceMethods.description: resolves if the page is saved.

parameters.name: fullPath
parameters.description: The full file path.

parameters.name: saveType
parameters.description: Specify the save type.

possibleValues.description: Save only the HTML of the page.
Save complete-html page.
Save complete-html page as MHTML.

instanceMethods.name: showDefinitionForSelection
instanceMethods.description: Shows pop-up dictionary that searches the selected word on the page.

instanceMethods.name: isOffscreen
instanceMethods.description: Indicates whether *offscreen rendering* is enabled.

instanceMethods.name: startPainting
instanceMethods.description: If *offscreen rendering* is enabled and not painting, start painting.

instanceMethods.name: stopPainting
instanceMethods.description: If *offscreen rendering* is enabled and painting, stop painting.

instanceMethods.name: isPainting
instanceMethods.description: If *offscreen rendering* is enabled returns whether it is currently painting.

instanceMethods.name: setFrameRate
instanceMethods.description:
If *offscreen rendering* is enabled sets the frame rate to the specified number. Only values between 1 and 60 are accepted.

**Deprecated**

instanceMethods.name: getFrameRate
instanceMethods.description:
If *offscreen rendering* is enabled returns the current frame rate.

**Deprecated**

instanceMethods.name: invalidate
instanceMethods.description:
Schedules a full repaint of the window this web contents is in.

If *offscreen rendering* is enabled invalidates the frame and generates a new one through the `'paint'` event.

instanceMethods.name: getWebRTCIPHandlingPolicy
instanceMethods.description: Returns the WebRTC IP Handling Policy.

instanceMethods.name: setWebRTCIPHandlingPolicy
instanceMethods.description: Setting the WebRTC IP handling policy allows you to control which IPs are exposed via WebRTC. See BrowserLeaks for more details.

parameters.name: policy
parameters.description: Specify the WebRTC IP Handling Policy.

possibleValues.description: Exposes user's public and local IPs. This is the default behavior. When this policy is used, WebRTC has the right to enumerate all interfaces and bind them to discover public interfaces.
Exposes user's public IP, but does not expose user's local IP. When this policy is used, WebRTC should only use the default route used by http. This doesn't expose any local addresses.

Exposes user's public and local IPs. When this policy is used, WebRTC should only use the default route used by http. This also exposes the associated default private address. Default route is the route chosen by the OS on a multi-homed endpoint.
Does not expose public or local IPs. When this policy is used, WebRTC should only use TCP to contact peers or servers unless the proxy server supports UDP.

instanceMethods.name: getOSProcessId
instanceMethods.description: The operating system `pid` of the associated renderer process.

instanceMethods.name: getProcessId
instanceMethods.description: The Chromium internal `pid` of the associated renderer. Can be compared to the `frameProcessId` passed by frame specific navigation events (e.g. `did-frame-navigate`)

instanceMethods.name: takeHeapSnapshot
instanceMethods.description:
Indicates whether the snapshot has been created successfully.

Takes a V8 heap snapshot and saves it to `filePath`.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path to the output file.

instanceMethods.name: setBackgroundThrottling
instanceMethods.description: Controls whether or not this WebContents will throttle animations and timers when the page becomes backgrounded. This also affects the Page Visibility API.

instanceMethods.name: getType
instanceMethods.description: the type of the webContent. Can be `backgroundPage`, `window`, `browserView`, `remote`, `webview` or `offscreen`.

instanceProperties.name: audioMuted
instanceProperties.description: A `Boolean` property that determines whether this page is muted.

instanceProperties.name: userAgent
instanceProperties.description: A `String` property that determines the user agent for this web page.

instanceProperties.name: zoomLevel
instanceProperties.description:
A `Number` property that determines the zoom level for this web contents.

The original size is 0 and each increment above or below represents zooming 20% larger or smaller to default limits of 300% and 50% of original size, respectively. The formula for this is `scale := 1.2 ^ level`.

instanceProperties.name: zoomFactor
instanceProperties.description:
A `Number` property that determines the zoom factor for this web contents.

The zoom factor is the zoom percent divided by 100, so 300% = 3.0.

instanceProperties.name: frameRate
instanceProperties.description:
An `Integer` property that sets the frame rate of the web contents to the specified number. Only values between 1 and 60 are accepted.

Only applicable if *offscreen rendering* is enabled.

instanceProperties.name: id
instanceProperties.description: A `Integer` representing the unique ID of this WebContents.

instanceProperties.name: session
instanceProperties.description: A `Session` used by this webContents.

instanceProperties.name: hostWebContents
instanceProperties.description: A `WebContents` instance that might own this `WebContents`.

instanceProperties.name: devToolsWebContents
instanceProperties.description:
A `WebContents` of DevTools for this `WebContents`.

**Note:** Users should never store this object because it may become `null` when the DevTools has been closed.

instanceProperties.name: debugger
instanceProperties.description: A `Debugger` instance for this webContents.

instanceEvents.name: did-finish-load
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the navigation is done, i.e. the spinner of the tab has stopped spinning, and the `onload` event was dispatched.

instanceEvents.name: did-fail-load
instanceEvents.description: This event is like `did-finish-load` but emitted when the load failed. The full list of error codes and their meaning is available here.

instanceEvents.name: did-fail-provisional-load
instanceEvents.description: This event is like `did-fail-load` but emitted when the load was cancelled (e.g. `window.stop()` was invoked).

instanceEvents.name: did-frame-finish-load
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a frame has done navigation.

instanceEvents.name: did-start-loading
instanceEvents.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab started spinning.

instanceEvents.name: did-stop-loading
instanceEvents.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab stopped spinning.

instanceEvents.name: dom-ready
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the document in the given frame is loaded.

instanceEvents.name: page-title-updated
instanceEvents.description: Fired when page title is set during navigation. `explicitSet` is false when title is synthesized from file url.

instanceEvents.name: page-favicon-updated
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when page receives favicon urls.

parameters.name: favicons
parameters.description: Array of URLs.

instanceEvents.name: new-window
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when the page requests to open a new window for a `url`. It could be requested by `window.open` or an external link like `<a target='_blank'>`.

By default a new `BrowserWindow` will be created for the `url`.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent Electron from automatically creating a new `BrowserWindow`. If you call `event.preventDefault()` and manually create a new `BrowserWindow` then you must set `event.newGuest` to reference the new `BrowserWindow` instance, failing to do so may result in unexpected behavior. For example:

parameters.name: disposition
parameters.description: Can be `default`, `foreground-tab`, `background-tab`, `new-window`, `save-to-disk` and `other`.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The options which will be used for creating the new `BrowserWindow`.

parameters.name: additionalFeatures
parameters.description: The non-standard features (features not handled by Chromium or Electron) given to `window.open()`.

parameters.name: referrer
parameters.description: The referrer that will be passed to the new window. May or may not result in the `Referer` header being sent, depending on the referrer policy.

instanceEvents.name: will-navigate
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a user or the page wants to start navigation. It can happen when the `window.location` object is changed or a user clicks a link in the page.

This event will not emit when the navigation is started programmatically with APIs like `webContents.loadURL` and `webContents.back`.

It is also not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the navigation.

instanceEvents.name: did-start-navigation
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when any frame (including main) starts navigating. `isInplace` will be `true` for in-page navigations.

instanceEvents.name: will-redirect
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted as a server side redirect occurs during navigation.  For example a 302 redirect.

This event will be emitted after `did-start-navigation` and always before the `did-redirect-navigation` event for the same navigation.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the navigation (not just the redirect).

instanceEvents.name: did-redirect-navigation
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted after a server side redirect occurs during navigation.  For example a 302 redirect.

This event can not be prevented, if you want to prevent redirects you should checkout out the `will-redirect` event above.

instanceEvents.name: did-navigate
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a main frame navigation is done.

This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

parameters.name: httpResponseCode
parameters.description: -1 for non HTTP navigations

parameters.name: httpStatusText
parameters.description: empty for non HTTP navigations

instanceEvents.name: did-frame-navigate
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when any frame navigation is done.

This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

parameters.name: httpResponseCode
parameters.description: -1 for non HTTP navigations

parameters.name: httpStatusText
parameters.description: empty for non HTTP navigations,

instanceEvents.name: did-navigate-in-page
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when an in-page navigation happened in any frame.

When in-page navigation happens, the page URL changes but does not cause navigation outside of the page. Examples of this occurring are when anchor links are clicked or when the DOM `hashchange` event is triggered.

instanceEvents.name: will-prevent-unload
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a `beforeunload` event handler is attempting to cancel a page unload.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` will ignore the `beforeunload` event handler and allow the page to be unloaded.

instanceEvents.name: crashed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the renderer process crashes or is killed.

instanceEvents.name: unresponsive
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the web page becomes unresponsive.

instanceEvents.name: responsive
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the unresponsive web page becomes responsive again.

instanceEvents.name: plugin-crashed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a plugin process has crashed.

instanceEvents.name: destroyed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `webContents` is destroyed.

instanceEvents.name: before-input-event
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted before dispatching the `keydown` and `keyup` events in the page. Calling `event.preventDefault` will prevent the page `keydown`/`keyup` events and the menu shortcuts.

To only prevent the menu shortcuts, use `setIgnoreMenuShortcuts`:

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Input properties.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Either `keyUp` or `keyDown`.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.key.

properties.name: code
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.code.

properties.name: isAutoRepeat
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.repeat.

properties.name: shift
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.shiftKey.

properties.name: control
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.controlKey.

properties.name: alt
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.altKey.

properties.name: meta
properties.description: Equivalent to KeyboardEvent.metaKey.

instanceEvents.name: enter-html-full-screen
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the window enters a full-screen state triggered by HTML API.

instanceEvents.name: leave-html-full-screen
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the window leaves a full-screen state triggered by HTML API.

instanceEvents.name: zoom-changed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the user is requesting to change the zoom level using the mouse wheel.

parameters.name: zoomDirection
parameters.description: Can be `in` or `out`.

instanceEvents.name: devtools-opened
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when DevTools is opened.

instanceEvents.name: devtools-closed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when DevTools is closed.

instanceEvents.name: devtools-focused
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when DevTools is focused / opened.

instanceEvents.name: certificate-error
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when failed to verify the `certificate` for `url`.

The usage is the same with the `certificate-error` event of `app`.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: The error code.

parameters.name: isTrusted
parameters.description: Indicates whether the certificate can be considered trusted.

instanceEvents.name: select-client-certificate
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a client certificate is requested.

The usage is the same with the `select-client-certificate` event of `app`.

parameters.name: certificate
parameters.description: Must be a certificate from the given list.

instanceEvents.name: login
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when `webContents` wants to do basic auth.

The usage is the same with the `login` event of `app`.

instanceEvents.name: found-in-page
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a result is available for [`webContents.findInPage`] request.

properties.name: activeMatchOrdinal

properties.name: matches

properties.name: selectionArea
properties.description: Coordinates of first match region.

instanceEvents.name: media-started-playing
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when media starts playing.

instanceEvents.name: media-paused
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when media is paused or done playing.

instanceEvents.name: did-change-theme-color
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a page's theme color changes. This is usually due to encountering a meta tag:

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Theme color is in format of '#rrggbb'. It is `null` when no theme color is set.

instanceEvents.name: update-target-url
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when mouse moves over a link or the keyboard moves the focus to a link.

instanceEvents.name: cursor-changed
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when the cursor's type changes. The `type` parameter can be `default`, `crosshair`, `pointer`, `text`, `wait`, `help`, `e-resize`, `n-resize`, `ne-resize`, `nw-resize`, `s-resize`, `se-resize`, `sw-resize`, `w-resize`, `ns-resize`, `ew-resize`, `nesw-resize`, `nwse-resize`, `col-resize`, `row-resize`, `m-panning`, `e-panning`, `n-panning`, `ne-panning`, `nw-panning`, `s-panning`, `se-panning`, `sw-panning`, `w-panning`, `move`, `vertical-text`, `cell`, `context-menu`, `alias`, `progress`, `nodrop`, `copy`, `none`, `not-allowed`, `zoom-in`, `zoom-out`, `grab`, `grabbing` or `custom`.

If the `type` parameter is `custom`, the `image` parameter will hold the custom cursor image in a `NativeImage`, and `scale`, `size` and `hotspot` will hold additional information about the custom cursor.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: scaling factor for the custom cursor.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the size of the `image`.

parameters.name: hotspot
parameters.description: coordinates of the custom cursor's hotspot.

instanceEvents.name: context-menu
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when there is a new context menu that needs to be handled.

properties.name: x
properties.description: x coordinate.

properties.name: y
properties.description: y coordinate.

properties.name: linkURL
properties.description: URL of the link that encloses the node the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: linkText
properties.description: Text associated with the link. May be an empty string if the contents of the link are an image.

properties.name: pageURL
properties.description: URL of the top level page that the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: frameURL
properties.description: URL of the subframe that the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: srcURL
properties.description: Source URL for the element that the context menu was invoked on. Elements with source URLs are images, audio and video.

properties.name: mediaType
properties.description: Type of the node the context menu was invoked on. Can be `none`, `image`, `audio`, `video`, `canvas`, `file` or `plugin`.

properties.name: hasImageContents
properties.description: Whether the context menu was invoked on an image which has non-empty contents.

properties.name: isEditable
properties.description: Whether the context is editable.

properties.name: selectionText
properties.description: Text of the selection that the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: titleText
properties.description: Title or alt text of the selection that the context was invoked on.

properties.name: misspelledWord
properties.description: The misspelled word under the cursor, if any.

properties.name: dictionarySuggestions
properties.description: An array of suggested words to show the user to replace the `misspelledWord`.  Only available if there is a misspelled word and spellchecker is enabled.

properties.name: frameCharset
properties.description: The character encoding of the frame on which the menu was invoked.

properties.name: inputFieldType
properties.description: If the context menu was invoked on an input field, the type of that field. Possible values are `none`, `plainText`, `password`, `other`.

properties.name: menuSourceType
properties.description: Input source that invoked the context menu. Can be `none`, `mouse`, `keyboard`, `touch` or `touchMenu`.

properties.name: mediaFlags
properties.description: The flags for the media element the context menu was invoked on.

properties.name: inError
properties.description: Whether the media element has crashed.

properties.name: isPaused
properties.description: Whether the media element is paused.

properties.name: isMuted
properties.description: Whether the media element is muted.

properties.name: hasAudio
properties.description: Whether the media element has audio.

properties.name: isLooping
properties.description: Whether the media element is looping.

properties.name: isControlsVisible
properties.description: Whether the media element's controls are visible.

properties.name: canToggleControls
properties.description: Whether the media element's controls are toggleable.

properties.name: canRotate
properties.description: Whether the media element can be rotated.

properties.name: editFlags
properties.description: These flags indicate whether the renderer believes it is able to perform the corresponding action.

properties.name: canUndo
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can undo.

properties.name: canRedo
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can redo.

properties.name: canCut
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can cut.

properties.name: canCopy
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can copy

properties.name: canPaste
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can paste.

properties.name: canDelete
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can delete.

properties.name: canSelectAll
properties.description: Whether the renderer believes it can select all.

instanceEvents.name: select-bluetooth-device
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when bluetooth device needs to be selected on call to `navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice`. To use `navigator.bluetooth` api `webBluetooth` should be enabled. If `event.preventDefault` is not called, first available device will be selected. `callback` should be called with `deviceId` to be selected, passing empty string to `callback` will cancel the request.

instanceEvents.name: paint
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a new frame is generated. Only the dirty area is passed in the buffer.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The image data of the whole frame.

instanceEvents.name: devtools-reload-page
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the devtools window instructs the webContents to reload

instanceEvents.name: will-attach-webview
instanceEvents.description:
Emitted when a `<webview>`'s web contents is being attached to this web contents. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will destroy the guest page.

This event can be used to configure `webPreferences` for the `webContents` of a `<webview>` before it's loaded, and provides the ability to set settings that can't be set via `<webview>` attributes.

**Note:** The specified `preload` script option will be appear as `preloadURL` (not `preload`) in the `webPreferences` object emitted with this event.

parameters.name: webPreferences
parameters.description: The web preferences that will be used by the guest page. This object can be modified to adjust the preferences for the guest page.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: The other `<webview>` parameters such as the `src` URL. This object can be modified to adjust the parameters of the guest page.

instanceEvents.name: did-attach-webview
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a `<webview>` has been attached to this web contents.

parameters.name: webContents
parameters.description: The guest web contents that is used by the `<webview>`.

instanceEvents.name: console-message
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the associated window logs a console message.

instanceEvents.name: preload-error
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the preload script `preloadPath` throws an unhandled exception `error`.

instanceEvents.name: ipc-message
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the renderer process sends an asynchronous message via `ipcRenderer.send()`.

instanceEvents.name: ipc-message-sync
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the renderer process sends a synchronous message via `ipcRenderer.sendSync()`.

instanceEvents.name: desktop-capturer-get-sources
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `desktopCapturer.getSources()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will make it return empty sources.

instanceEvents.name: remote-require
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.require()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the module from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: remote-get-global
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.getGlobal()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the global from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: remote-get-builtin
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.getBuiltin()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the module from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: remote-get-current-window
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.getCurrentWindow()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the object from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: remote-get-current-web-contents
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `remote.getCurrentWebContents()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the object from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

instanceEvents.name: remote-get-guest-web-contents
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when `<webview>.getWebContents()` is called in the renderer process. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the object from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting `event.returnValue`.

methods.name: setZoomFactor
methods.description:
Changes the zoom factor to the specified factor. Zoom factor is zoom percent divided by 100, so 300% = 3.0.

The factor must be greater than 0.0.

parameters.name: factor
parameters.description: Zoom factor; default is 1.0.

methods.name: getZoomFactor
methods.description: The current zoom factor.

methods.name: setZoomLevel
methods.description: Changes the zoom level to the specified level. The original size is 0 and each increment above or below represents zooming 20% larger or smaller to default limits of 300% and 50% of original size, respectively.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Zoom level.

methods.name: getZoomLevel
methods.description: The current zoom level.

methods.name: setVisualZoomLevelLimits
methods.description:
Sets the maximum and minimum pinch-to-zoom level.

> **NOTE**: Visual zoom is disabled by default in Electron. To re-enable it, call:

methods.name: setLayoutZoomLevelLimits
methods.description:
Sets the maximum and minimum layout-based (i.e. non-visual) zoom level.

**Deprecated:** This API is no longer supported by Chromium.

methods.name: setSpellCheckProvider
methods.description:
Sets a provider for spell checking in input fields and text areas.

If you want to use this method you must disable the builtin spellchecker when you construct the window.

The `provider` must be an object that has a `spellCheck` method that accepts an array of individual words for spellchecking. The `spellCheck` function runs asynchronously and calls the `callback` function with an array of misspelt words when complete.

An example of using node-spellchecker as provider:

methods.name: insertCSS
methods.description:
A key for the inserted CSS that can later be used to remove the CSS via `webFrame.removeInsertedCSS(key)`.

Injects CSS into the current web page and returns a unique key for the inserted stylesheet.

parameters.name: css
parameters.description: CSS source code.

methods.name: removeInsertedCSS
methods.description: Removes the inserted CSS from the current web page. The stylesheet is identified by its key, which is returned from `webFrame.insertCSS(css)`.

methods.name: insertText
methods.description: Inserts `text` to the focused element.

methods.name: executeJavaScript
methods.description:
A promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if the result of the code is a rejected promise.

Evaluates `code` in page.

In the browser window some HTML APIs like `requestFullScreen` can only be invoked by a gesture from the user. Setting `userGesture` to `true` will remove this limitation.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Default is `false`.

methods.name: executeJavaScriptInIsolatedWorld
methods.description:
A promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if the result of the code is a rejected promise.

Works like `executeJavaScript` but evaluates `scripts` in an isolated context.

parameters.name: worldId
parameters.description: The ID of the world to run the javascript in, `0` is the default world, `999` is the world used by Electrons `contextIsolation` feature.  You can provide any integer here.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Default is `false`.

methods.name: setIsolatedWorldInfo
methods.description: Set the security origin, content security policy and name of the isolated world. Note: If the `csp` is specified, then the `securityOrigin` also has to be specified.

parameters.name: worldId
parameters.description: The ID of the world to run the javascript in, `0` is the default world, `999` is the world used by Electrons `contextIsolation` feature. Chrome extensions reserve the range of IDs in `[1 << 20, 1 << 29)`. You can provide any integer here.

properties.name: securityOrigin
properties.description: Security origin for the isolated world.

properties.name: csp
properties.description: Content Security Policy for the isolated world.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name for isolated world. Useful in devtools.

methods.name: getResourceUsage
methods.description:
* `images` MemoryUsageDetails
* `scripts` MemoryUsageDetails
* `cssStyleSheets` MemoryUsageDetails
* `xslStyleSheets` MemoryUsageDetails
* `fonts` MemoryUsageDetails
* `other` MemoryUsageDetails

Returns an object describing usage information of Blink's internal memory caches.

This will generate:

methods.name: clearCache
methods.description:
Attempts to free memory that is no longer being used (like images from a previous navigation).

Note that blindly calling this method probably makes Electron slower since it will have to refill these emptied caches, you should only call it if an event in your app has occurred that makes you think your page is actually using less memory (i.e. you have navigated from a super heavy page to a mostly empty one, and intend to stay there).

methods.name: getFrameForSelector
methods.description: The frame element in `webFrame's` document selected by `selector`, `null` would be returned if `selector` does not select a frame or if the frame is not in the current renderer process.

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: CSS selector for a frame element.

methods.name: findFrameByName
methods.description: A child of `webFrame` with the supplied `name`, `null` would be returned if there's no such frame or if the frame is not in the current renderer process.

methods.name: findFrameByRoutingId
methods.description: that has the supplied `routingId`, `null` if not found.

parameters.name: routingId
parameters.description: An `Integer` representing the unique frame id in the current renderer process. Routing IDs can be retrieved from `WebFrame` instances (`webFrame.routingId`) and are also passed by frame specific `WebContents` navigation events (e.g. `did-frame-navigate`)

properties.name: top
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing top frame in frame hierarchy to which `webFrame` belongs, the property would be `null` if top frame is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: opener
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing the frame which opened `webFrame`, the property would be `null` if there's no opener or opener is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing parent frame of `webFrame`, the property would be `null` if `webFrame` is top or parent is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: firstChild
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing the first child frame of `webFrame`, the property would be `null` if `webFrame` has no children or if first child is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: nextSibling
properties.description: A `WebFrame | null` representing next sibling frame, the property would be `null` if `webFrame` is the last frame in its parent or if the next sibling is not in the current renderer process.

properties.name: routingId
properties.description: An `Integer` representing the unique frame id in the current renderer process. Distinct WebFrame instances that refer to the same underlying frame will have the same `routingId`.

instanceMethods.name: onBeforeRequest
instanceMethods.description:
The `listener` will be called with `listener(details, callback)` when a request is about to occur.

The `uploadData` is an array of `UploadData` objects.

The `callback` has to be called with an `response` object.

Some examples of valid `urls`:

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: redirectURL
properties.description: The original request is prevented from being sent or completed and is instead redirected to the given URL.

instanceMethods.name: onBeforeSendHeaders
instanceMethods.description:
The `listener` will be called with `listener(details, callback)` before sending an HTTP request, once the request headers are available. This may occur after a TCP connection is made to the server, but before any http data is sent.

The `callback` has to be called with a `response` object.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: requestHeaders
properties.description: When provided, request will be made with these headers.

instanceMethods.name: onSendHeaders
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` just before a request is going to be sent to the server, modifications of previous `onBeforeSendHeaders` response are visible by the time this listener is fired.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

instanceMethods.name: onHeadersReceived
instanceMethods.description:
The `listener` will be called with `listener(details, callback)` when HTTP response headers of a request have been received.

The `callback` has to be called with a `response` object.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: responseHeaders
properties.description: When provided, the server is assumed to have responded with these headers.

properties.name: statusLine
properties.description: Should be provided when overriding `responseHeaders` to change header status otherwise original response header's status will be used.

instanceMethods.name: onResponseStarted
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` when first byte of the response body is received. For HTTP requests, this means that the status line and response headers are available.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: fromCache
properties.description: Indicates whether the response was fetched from disk cache.

instanceMethods.name: onBeforeRedirect
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` when a server initiated redirect is about to occur.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: ip
properties.description: The server IP address that the request was actually sent to.

instanceMethods.name: onCompleted
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` when a request is completed.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

instanceMethods.name: onErrorOccurred
instanceMethods.description: The `listener` will be called with `listener(details)` when an error occurs.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns.

properties.name: error
properties.description: The error description.

methods.name: loadURL
methods.description:
The promise will resolve when the page has finished loading (see `did-finish-load`), and rejects if the page fails to load (see `did-fail-load`).

Loads the `url` in the webview, the `url` must contain the protocol prefix, e.g. the `http://` or `file://`.

properties.name: httpReferrer

properties.name: userAgent

properties.name: extraHeaders

properties.name: baseURLForDataURL
properties.description: Base url (with trailing path separator) for files to be loaded by the data url. This is needed only if the specified `url` is a data url and needs to load other files.

methods.name: downloadURL
methods.description: Initiates a download of the resource at `url` without navigating.

methods.name: getURL
methods.description: The URL of guest page.

methods.name: getTitle
methods.description: The title of guest page.

methods.name: isLoading
methods.description: Whether guest page is still loading resources.

methods.name: isLoadingMainFrame
methods.description: Whether the main frame (and not just iframes or frames within it) is still loading.

methods.name: isWaitingForResponse
methods.description: Whether the guest page is waiting for a first-response for the main resource of the page.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops any pending navigation.

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reloads the guest page.

methods.name: reloadIgnoringCache

methods.name: canGoToOffset

A promise that resolves with a key for the inserted CSS that can later be used to remove the CSS via `<webview>.removeInsertedCSS(key)`.

methods.name: findInPage
methods.description:
The request id used for the request.

Starts a request to find all matches for the `text` in the web page. The result of the request can be obtained by subscribing to `found-in-page` event.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Content to be searched, must not be empty.

properties.name: forward

properties.description: Whether the operation is first request or a follow up, defaults to `false`.

properties.description: Whether to look only at the start of words. defaults to `false`.

properties.description: When combined with `wordStart`, accepts a match in the middle of a word if the match begins with an uppercase letter followed by a lowercase or non-letter. Accepts several other intra-word matches, defaults to `false`.

methods.name: getZoomLevel

methods.name: setLayoutZoomLevelLimits
methods.description:
Sets the maximum and minimum layout-based (i.e. non-visual) zoom level.

**Deprecated:** This API is no longer supported by Chromium.

methods.name: showDefinitionForSelection
methods.description: Shows pop-up dictionary that searches the selected word on the page.

methods.name: getWebContents
methods.description:
The web contents associated with this `webview`.

It depends on the `remote` module, it is therefore not available when this module is disabled.

methods.name: getWebContentsId
methods.description: The WebContents ID of this `webview`.

properties.name: src
properties.description:
A `String` representing the visible URL. Writing to this attribute initiates top-level navigation.

Assigning `src` its own value will reload the current page.

The `src` attribute can also accept data URLs, such as `data:text/plain,Hello, world!`.

properties.name: nodeintegration
properties.description: A `Boolean`. When this attribute is present the guest page in `webview` will have node integration and can use node APIs like `require` and `process` to access low level system resources. Node integration is disabled by default in the guest page.

properties.name: nodeintegrationinsubframes
properties.description: A `Boolean` for the experimental option for enabling NodeJS support in sub-frames such as iframes inside the `webview`. All your preloads will load for every iframe, you can use `process.isMainFrame` to determine if you are in the main frame or not. This option is disabled by default in the guest page.

properties.name: enableremotemodule
properties.description: A `Boolean`. When this attribute is `false` the guest page in `webview` will not have access to the `remote` module. The remote module is available by default.

properties.name: plugins
properties.description: A `Boolean`. When this attribute is present the guest page in `webview` will be able to use browser plugins. Plugins are disabled by default.

properties.name: preload
properties.description:
A `String` that specifies a script that will be loaded before other scripts run in the guest page. The protocol of script's URL must be either `file:` or `asar:`, because it will be loaded by `require` in guest page under the hood.

When the guest page doesn't have node integration this script will still have access to all Node APIs, but global objects injected by Node will be deleted after this script has finished executing.

**Note:** This option will appear as `preloadURL` (not `preload`) in the `webPreferences` specified to the `will-attach-webview` event.

properties.name: httpreferrer
properties.description: A `String` that sets the referrer URL for the guest page.

properties.name: useragent
properties.description: A `String` that sets the user agent for the guest page before the page is navigated to. Once the page is loaded, use the `setUserAgent` method to change the user agent.

properties.name: disablewebsecurity
properties.description: A `Boolean`. When this attribute is present the guest page will have web security disabled. Web security is enabled by default.

properties.name: partition
properties.description:
A `String` that sets the session used by the page. If `partition` starts with `persist:`, the page will use a persistent session available to all pages in the app with the same `partition`. if there is no `persist:` prefix, the page will use an in-memory session. By assigning the same `partition`, multiple pages can share the same session. If the `partition` is unset then default session of the app will be used.

This value can only be modified before the first navigation, since the session of an active renderer process cannot change. Subsequent attempts to modify the value will fail with a DOM exception.

properties.name: allowpopups
properties.description: A `Boolean`. When this attribute is present the guest page will be allowed to open new windows. Popups are disabled by default.

properties.name: webpreferences
properties.description:
A `String` which is a comma separated list of strings which specifies the web preferences to be set on the webview. The full list of supported preference strings can be found in BrowserWindow.

The string follows the same format as the features string in `window.open`. A name by itself is given a `true` boolean value. A preference can be set to another value by including an `=`, followed by the value. Special values `yes` and `1` are interpreted as `true`, while `no` and `0` are interpreted as `false`.

properties.name: enableblinkfeatures
properties.description: A `String` which is a list of strings which specifies the blink features to be enabled separated by `,`. The full list of supported feature strings can be found in the RuntimeEnabledFeatures.json5 file.

properties.name: disableblinkfeatures
properties.description: A `String` which is a list of strings which specifies the blink features to be disabled separated by `,`. The full list of supported feature strings can be found in the RuntimeEnabledFeatures.json5 file.

events.name: load-commit
events.description: Fired when a load has committed. This includes navigation within the current document as well as subframe document-level loads, but does not include asynchronous resource loads.

events.name: did-finish-load
events.description: Fired when the navigation is done, i.e. the spinner of the tab will stop spinning, and the `onload` event is dispatched.

events.name: did-fail-load
events.description: This event is like `did-finish-load`, but fired when the load failed or was cancelled, e.g. `window.stop()` is invoked.

events.name: did-frame-finish-load
events.description: Fired when a frame has done navigation.

events.name: did-start-loading
events.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab starts spinning.

events.name: did-stop-loading
events.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab stops spinning.

events.name: dom-ready
events.description: Fired when document in the given frame is loaded.

events.name: page-title-updated
events.description: Fired when page title is set during navigation. `explicitSet` is false when title is synthesized from file url.

events.name: page-favicon-updated
events.description: Fired when page receives favicon urls.

parameters.name: favicons
parameters.description: Array of URLs.

events.name: enter-html-full-screen
events.description: Fired when page enters fullscreen triggered by HTML API.

events.name: leave-html-full-screen
events.description: Fired when page leaves fullscreen triggered by HTML API.

events.name: console-message
events.description:
Fired when the guest window logs a console message.

The following example code forwards all log messages to the embedder's console without regard for log level or other properties.

events.name: found-in-page
events.description: Fired when a result is available for `webview.findInPage` request.

properties.name: activeMatchOrdinal
properties.description: Position of the active match.

properties.name: matches
properties.description: Number of Matches.

properties.name: selectionArea
properties.description: Coordinates of first match region.

events.name: new-window
events.description:
Fired when the guest page attempts to open a new browser window.

The following example code opens the new url in system's default browser.

parameters.name: disposition
parameters.description: Can be `default`, `foreground-tab`, `background-tab`, `new-window`, `save-to-disk` and `other`.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The options which should be used for creating the new `BrowserWindow`.

events.name: will-navigate
events.description:
Emitted when a user or the page wants to start navigation. It can happen when the `window.location` object is changed or a user clicks a link in the page.

This event will not emit when the navigation is started programmatically with APIs like `<webview>.loadURL` and `<webview>.back`.

It is also not emitted during in-page navigation, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

Calling `event.preventDefault()` does __NOT__ have any effect.

events.name: did-navigate
events.description:
Emitted when a navigation is done.

This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the `window.location.hash`. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.

events.name: did-navigate-in-page
events.description:
Emitted when an in-page navigation happened.

When in-page navigation happens, the page URL changes but does not cause navigation outside of the page. Examples of this occurring are when anchor links are clicked or when the DOM `hashchange` event is triggered.

events.name: close
events.description:
Fired when the guest page attempts to close itself.

The following example code navigates the `webview` to `about:blank` when the guest attempts to close itself.

events.name: ipc-message
events.description:
Fired when the guest page has sent an asynchronous message to embedder page.

With `sendToHost` method and `ipc-message` event you can communicate between guest page and embedder page:

events.name: crashed
events.description: Fired when the renderer process is crashed.

events.name: plugin-crashed
events.description: Fired when a plugin process is crashed.

events.name: destroyed
events.description: Fired when the WebContents is destroyed.

events.name: media-started-playing
events.description: Emitted when media starts playing.

events.name: media-paused
events.description: Emitted when media is paused or done playing.

events.name: did-change-theme-color
events.description: Emitted when a page's theme color changes. This is usually due to encountering a meta tag:

events.name: update-target-url
events.description: Emitted when mouse moves over a link or the keyboard moves the focus to a link.

events.name: devtools-opened
events.description: Emitted when DevTools is opened.

events.name: devtools-closed
events.description: Emitted when DevTools is closed.

events.name: devtools-focused
events.description: Emitted when DevTools is focused / opened.

name: Display
description: The `Display` object represents a physical display connected to the system. A fake `Display` may exist on a headless system, or a `Display` may correspond to a remote, virtual display.

properties.name: id

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: Can be 0, 90, 180, 270, represents screen rotation in clock-wise degrees.

properties.name: scaleFactor

properties.name: touchSupport
properties.description: Can be `available`, `unavailable`, `unknown`.

properties.name: monochrome

properties.name: accelerometerSupport

properties.name: colorSpace
properties.description: represent a color space (three-dimensional object which contains all realizable color combinations) for the purpose of color conversions

properties.name: colorDepth
properties.description: The number of bits per pixel.

properties.name: depthPerComponent
properties.description: The number of bits per color component.

properties.name: internal

properties.name: path

properties.name: headers

name: GPUFeatureStatus
description:
Possible values:

* `disabled_software` - Software only. Hardware acceleration disabled (yellow)
* `disabled_off` - Disabled (red)
* `disabled_off_ok` - Disabled (yellow)
* `unavailable_software` - Software only, hardware acceleration unavailable (yellow)
* `unavailable_off` - Unavailable (red)
* `unavailable_off_ok` - Unavailable (yellow)
* `enabled_readback` - Hardware accelerated but at reduced performance (yellow)
* `enabled_force` - Hardware accelerated on all pages (green)
* `enabled` - Hardware accelerated (green)
* `enabled_on` - Enabled (green)
* `enabled_force_on` - Force enabled (green)

properties.name: frameId

properties.name: sender

properties.name: senderId
properties.description: The `webContents.id` that sent the message, you can call `event.sender.sendTo(event.senderId, ...)` to reply to the message, see ipcRenderer.sendTo for more information. This only applies to messages sent from a different renderer. Messages sent directly from the main process set `event.senderId` to `0`.

name: JumpListCategory
description: **Note:** If a `JumpListCategory` object has neither the `type` nor the `name` property set then its `type` is assumed to be `tasks`. If the `name` property is set but the `type` property is omitted then the `type` is assumed to be `custom`.

properties.name: type
properties.description: One of the following:

possibleValues.description: Items in this category will be placed into the standard `Tasks` category. There can be only one such category, and it will always be displayed at the bottom of the Jump List.
Displays a list of files frequently opened by the app, the name of the category and its items are set by Windows.
Displays a list of files recently opened by the app, the name of the category and its items are set by Windows. Items may be added to this category indirectly using `app.addRecentDocument(path)`.
Displays tasks or file links, `name` must be set by the app.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Must be set if `type` is `custom`, otherwise it should be omitted.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Array of `JumpListItem` objects if `type` is `tasks` or `custom`, otherwise it should be omitted.

properties.name: type
properties.description: One of the following:

possibleValues.description: A task will launch an app with specific arguments.
Can be used to separate items in the standard `Tasks` category.
A file link will open a file using the app that created the Jump List, for this to work the app must be registered as a handler for the file type (though it doesn't have to be the default handler).

properties.name: path
properties.description: Path of the file to open, should only be set if `type` is `file`.

properties.name: program
properties.description: Path of the program to execute, usually you should specify `process.execPath` which opens the current program. Should only be set if `type` is `task`.

properties.name: args
properties.description: The command line arguments when `program` is executed. Should only be set if `type` is `task`.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The text to be displayed for the item in the Jump List. Should only be set if `type` is `task`.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the task (displayed in a tooltip). Should only be set if `type` is `task`.

properties.name: iconPath
properties.description: The absolute path to an icon to be displayed in a Jump List, which can be an arbitrary resource file that contains an icon (e.g. `.ico`, `.exe`, `.dll`). You can usually specify `process.execPath` to show the program icon.

properties.name: iconIndex
properties.description: The index of the icon in the resource file. If a resource file contains multiple icons this value can be used to specify the zero-based index of the icon that should be displayed for this task. If a resource file contains only one icon, this property should be set to zero.

properties.name: workingDirectory
properties.description: The working directory. Default is empty.

properties.name: residentSet

When returning `Buffer` as response, this is a `Buffer`. When returning `String` as response, this is a `String`. This is ignored for other types of responses.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: An object containing the response headers.

properties.name: data
properties.description: A Node.js readable stream representing the response body.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: MIME type of the response.

properties.name: charset
properties.description: Charset of the response.

properties.name: data
properties.description: A string representing the response body.

properties.name: program
properties.description: Path of the program to execute, usually you should specify `process.execPath` which opens the current program.

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: The command line arguments when `program` is executed.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The string to be displayed in a JumpList.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of this task.

properties.name: iconPath
properties.description: The absolute path to an icon to be displayed in a JumpList, which can be an arbitrary resource file that contains an icon. You can usually specify `process.execPath` to show the icon of the program.

properties.name: iconIndex
properties.description: The icon index in the icon file. If an icon file consists of two or more icons, set this value to identify the icon. If an icon file consists of one icon, this value is 0.

properties.name: workingDirectory
properties.description: The working directory. Default is empty.

name: ThumbarButton
description:
The `flags` is an array that can include following `String`s:

* `enabled` - The button is active and available to the user.
* `disabled` - The button is disabled. It is present, but has a visual state indicating it will not respond to user action.
* `dismissonclick` - When the button is clicked, the thumbnail window closes immediately.
* `nobackground` - Do not draw a button border, use only the image.
* `hidden` - The button is not shown to the user.
* `noninteractive` - The button is enabled but not interactive; no pressed button state is drawn. This value is intended for instances where the button is used in a notification.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The icon showing in thumbnail toolbar.

properties.name: tooltip
properties.description: The text of the button's tooltip.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Control specific states and behaviors of the button. By default, it is `['enabled']`.

properties.name: categoryFilter
properties.description: A filter to control what category groups should be traced. A filter can have an optional '-' prefix to exclude category groups that contain a matching category. Having both included and excluded category patterns in the same list is not supported. Examples: `test_MyTest*`, `test_MyTest*,test_OtherStuff`, `-excluded_category1,-excluded_category2`.

properties.name: traceOptions
properties.description: Controls what kind of tracing is enabled, it is a comma-delimited sequence of the following strings: `record-until-full`, `record-continuously`, `trace-to-console`, `enable-sampling`, `enable-systrace`, e.g. `'record-until-full,enable-sampling'`. The first 3 options are trace recording modes and hence mutually exclusive. If more than one trace recording modes appear in the `traceOptions` string, the last one takes precedence. If none of the trace recording modes are specified, recording mode is `record-until-full`. The trace option will first be reset to the default option (`record_mode` set to `record-until-full`, `enable_sampling` and `enable_systrace` set to `false`) before options parsed from `traceOptions` are applied on it.

name: TraceConfig
description: An example TraceConfig that roughly matches what Chrome DevTools records:

properties.name: recording_mode
properties.description: Can be `record-until-full`, `record-continuously`, `record-as-much-as-possible` or `trace-to-console`. Defaults to `record-until-full`.

properties.name: trace_buffer_size_in_kb
properties.description: maximum size of the trace recording buffer in kilobytes. Defaults to 100MB.

properties.name: trace_buffer_size_in_events
properties.description: maximum size of the trace recording buffer in events.

properties.name: enable_argument_filter
properties.description: if true, filter event data according to a whitelist of events that have been manually vetted to not include any PII. See the implementation in Chromium for specifics.

properties.name: included_categories
properties.description: a list of tracing categories to include. Can include glob-like patterns using `*` at the end of the category name. See tracing categories for the list of categories.

properties.name: excluded_categories
properties.description: a list of tracing categories to exclude. Can include glob-like patterns using `*` at the end of the category name. See tracing categories for the list of categories.

properties.name: included_process_ids
properties.description: a list of process IDs to include in the trace. If not specified, trace all processes.

properties.name: histogram_names
properties.description: a list of histogram names to report with the trace.

properties.name: memory_dump_config
properties.description: if the `disabled-by-default-memory-infra` category is enabled, this contains optional additional configuration for data collection. See the Chromium memory-infra docs for more information.

properties.name: transactionIdentifier
properties.description: A string that uniquely identifies a successful payment transaction.

properties.name: transactionDate
properties.description: The date the transaction was added to the App Store’s payment queue.

properties.name: originalTransactionIdentifier
properties.description: The identifier of the restored transaction by the App Store.

properties.name: transactionState
properties.description: The transaction state, can be `purchasing`, `purchased`, `failed`, `restored` or `deferred`.

properties.name: errorCode
properties.description: The error code if an error occurred while processing the transaction.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: The error message if an error occurred while processing the transaction.

properties.name: productIdentifier
properties.description: The identifier of the purchased product.

properties.name: quantity
properties.description: The quantity purchased.

properties.name: type
properties.description: `blob`.

properties.name: blobUUID
properties.description: UUID of blob data to upload.

properties.name: bytes
properties.description: Content being sent.

properties.name: file
properties.description: Path of file being uploaded.

properties.name: blobUUID
properties.description: UUID of blob data. Use ses.getBlobData method to retrieve the data.

properties.name: type
properties.description: `file`.

properties.name: filePath
properties.description: Path of file to be uploaded.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Defaults to `0`.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Number of bytes to read from `offset`. Defaults to `0`.

properties.name: modificationTime
properties.description: Last Modification time in number of seconds since the UNIX epoch.

properties.name: type
properties.description: `rawData`.

properties.name: bytes
properties.description: Data to be uploaded.

properties.name: startLine
properties.description: Default is 1.
